title: Costume Contest
description: It's Halloween at Dunder Mifflin, and Michael is upset that Darryl went over his head with an idea, and Jim and Pam are obsessed with finding out why Danny didn't call Pam back when they were dating four years ago.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What about this one? It's kinda badass, right? Just seems kinda crazy in a way I might need right now.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I don't know. [looks at Stanley, who took his mug and is drinking out of it] Oh! That's... not... yours.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Stanley just drank OJ out of my mug, and didn't seem to realize that it wasn't his hot coffee. So the question has to be asked, is there no limit to what he won't notice?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: What's a seven letter word for purse?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [sitting at Phyllis' desk, dressed like Phyllis; high pitched voice] Satchel!

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Nope. Starts with an H.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [shirtless, wearing only a tie] Handbag.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Hmmm. [glances at Andy] Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Shh! Shhh! [watches Jim put a cardboard box over Stanley's monitor]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [standing outside the conference room, wearing fake teeth, watching Stanley walk in] All right, everybody, take a seat. As you may have heard, our branch on the planet Jupiter is up eight thousand percent in sales!

quotes.speaker: All
quotes.text: Yay! [applause]

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: [looks at the clock, then at his watch] Hold up! That clock is slow. It is five o'clock, I will see you all tomorrow:

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [turns around, is wearing a mustache] Bye, Stanley! Love you! [waves, Stanley leaves]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [standing next to a pony] So long, Stanley!

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Night, everybody.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: So what kind of statement are you making with that costume, Kevin?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: The statement that I am making, Oscar, is that I kind of look like Michael Moore.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Dunder Mifflin, this is Erin! Happy Halloween! How can I haunt you today?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: A lot of people are really getting into Halloween this year! [puts head down over fake bomb made from cardboard, high pitched voice] Six seconds, MacGruber! [lifts head] Pam's got a lot of fun stuff planned! [puts head down, high pitched voice] Uh, two seconds MacGruber! [lifts head] Including a... costume contest, and bobbing for apples, and a Ouija board... OHHH! BOOM! OHH EXPLOSION! [throws fake bomb, takes off sunglasses, points to camera] MACGRUBERRRR!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: People are really into the costume contest this year. Might have something to do with the prize, maybe you've heard of it. The 2011 Scranton Wilkes-Barre coupon book worth over fifteen thousand dollars in savings!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Stop.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [has his hands around Jim's neck] Too late! If I was the real Scranton Strangler, you'd be so strangled right now. If you're out there, strangler, you will get caught! By me.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Sounds like someone's really trying to convince us that he's not the Scranton Strangler.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: To my chickens I'm the Scranton Strangler.  [looks at Pam] Oh-ho! That's very funny. Looks like someone decided to dress up as old Dwight Schrute's mom.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You're only one third as beautiful and only half her height.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I'm supposed to be Olive Oyl. And it makes more sense when I'm standing next to Popeye, but... Jim doesn't want to put his costume on.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [places pipe in mouth] I am Popeye!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I've never really been a costume guy. Even when I was a kid, it just felt like something I was too old for. And then this morning, when Pam hands me this little number [holds up Popeye costume, shakes head] ...no.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: [dressed as Lady Gaga] In case you can't read m-m-my Poker Face... [laughs] we will be reviewing our sales policies. [accepts note from Michael, reads it out loud] I have ten seconds to read them or this whole place blows up.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: MACGRUBER!

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: Lame. Why don't witches wear panties?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, here we go!

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: Because they need to grip the broom!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [laughs] OH! Who likes to water ski on Lake Erie? No wai-where does Dracula like to water ski?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Lake Erie.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: When our warehouse workers make deliveries, they're going to be encouraged to offer clients extra products. And then they will split those commissions with sales.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So, wait, drivers are going to be able to sell paper on the road?

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: That is correct.

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: Has anyone started calling you "Gabe-wad" yet?

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Not here.

quotes.speaker: Danny
quotes.text: Gabe-wad.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Okay, guys, fun is fun, but-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Blackula!

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Dracula.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, so... I almost forgot. You'll find this hilarious. Apparently corporate is going to have drivers sell paper on their routes now. That's like, exactly sort of the idea that you had.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Yes. I do remember saying something like that to you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah. I'm sorry. I blew this. You should have gotten credit for that, man.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I'm just glad we're gonna try it out.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Really? We're good?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Yeah. We're cool.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay. [reaches out and shakes Darryl's hand] Okay.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: What's under your shirt?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh. It's a ream of paper. Thought you might hit me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Darryl Philbin is the greatest guy in the world. And you know what I'd like? I would like to have all the racists brought together and take Darryl Philbin out to lunch. Just to see what they're missing.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: [leans hobo sack against the refrigerator] It's a great stick, right?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: It's really good. It's a classic. I think you might win the whole thing with that.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Thanks!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Everyone realizes that this coupon book isn't actually worth fifteen thousand dollars, right? You'd have to spend two hundred thousand dollars on crap you don't actually need to get fifteen thousand dollars worth of benefits. I'm not the only one who sees this, right?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I get that. I get that.

quotes.speaker: Danny
quotes.text: Excuse me, everybody. I want to invite you all to the Halloween party I'm having at my bar.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: You own a bar?

quotes.speaker: Danny
quotes.text: Public School, at exit 11.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: That's a great name. You're hilarious. A plus!

quotes.speaker: Danny
quotes.text: So. You're all on the list!

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Hey, man, can I get a plus five? It's all guys.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Hey, what's the crowd like, Danny? Our age?

quotes.speaker: Danny
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I don't think that she would leave Jim for Danny.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: I don't know, they're both handsome.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Pam is gonna choose whoever has a scent most like that of her father. Does anyone remember what her dad smelled like?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: I think he-

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Hey hey hey, quiet, here she comes! Did you hear about that Danny guy? Heard he used to date Pam.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: So four years ago, when I was in Stamford, Connecticut, and dating someone else, Pam went on two dates with Danny. Which was obviously the greatest love story ever told, given how much people are walking on eggshells around us.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: We were basically Romeo and Juliet.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That's right.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Except where Juliet doesn't have that great a time and Romeo doesn't call back after two dates.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yikes.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: But I've learned to love again. [puts her arm on Jim's shoulder] He's a cartoon sailor.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, no.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: And looks so handsome in his UNIFORM! Please?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No. No, I'm not gonna-no.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Tuna! Tuna! Do you want us to skip this party?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I don't care.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I am never gonna forget what Danny did to Pam. I forget nothing. I'm like an elephant in that way.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You know what else? [pulling fake teeth out of his mouth] The-this... this sucks for Jim. Right? But it also sucks for us. Because we don't get invited to a ton of Halloween parties. [puts teeth back in]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yeah, and everyone else is gonna be there. Stanley, Phyllis, Angela, Darryl... Creed's a maybe.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [removes teeth] Creed's going?!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Madge from the warehouse just made her first sale. Madge. We should have been doing this a long time ago.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Erin! Would you please do me a solid and get Darryl Philbin on the speakerphone?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: [answers phone] Hello?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hi, Darryl, come out here, please.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I'm good.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You need to stop being so shy, come out here, and embrace who you really are, superstar!

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: This is embarrassing, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, I bet it is! If you're gonna do your job well here, you gotta get used to being embarrassed.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Let me put my shoes on. [hangs up phone, dial tone]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [leans over toward Erin] Um, hit the speakerphone button. The speakerphone button? The same button as you hit before... or sit on it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: This whole delivery slash sales idea? You know whose idea that was? That was Darryl Philbin's. He thought of that way before the corporate fat suits.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: So, what happened?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I got in the way. I said no. And it just stopped. But then corporate comes up with this idea, but you know what? They need to know that it was yours. And I don't care if I take a bullet. We're gonna call them, we're gonna put them on speakerphone right now...

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Oh! [fumbles for phone]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And we are going to straighten this out.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Screw corporate! They probably stole the idea anyway.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Mmhm!

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Uh uh. Corporate stole nothing, okay? Darryl told me, and then I told them, giving Darryl full credit, so... no need to [mimicking Andy] screw corporate! Or anything like that, so. Let's give Darryl a round of applause, as planned. [claps]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'm a little peeved at Darryl right now.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: He went to Gabe behind your back.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, he didn't go behind my back. He went over my head.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: He went over your head to go behind your back.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What is taking someone from behind?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No. Shh. Michael, listen. This cannot stand. We can't have workers going straight to corporate. Makes your job superfluous.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It was a good idea, though.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah. Here's another good idea. Corporate chain of command. We need to strangle Darryl's idea.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hey, Danny.

quotes.speaker: Danny
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I'm really sorry, but we can't come to your party tonight.

quotes.speaker: Danny
quotes.text: I was looking forward to throwing some darts with you guys.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You were?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Okay, well then, uh, I mean,  maybe we could do it like... next Halloween.

quotes.speaker: Danny
quotes.text: For sure.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: We're just like, totally caught in the middle here.

quotes.speaker: Danny
quotes.text: What are you talking about?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Well Jim and Pam basically begged us not to go...

quotes.speaker: Danny
quotes.text: Jim and Pam really don't want you to go?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: They're really upset about the whole Danny situation.

quotes.speaker: Danny
quotes.text: I'll talk to them.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yeah, but wait, don't tell them that we said anything to you.

quotes.speaker: Danny
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Or you're dead.

quotes.speaker: Danny
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Kelly! Great costume!

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: KELLY! You cannot change costumes in the middle of the day! Pam, she's out.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Um, if I'm out, I'm going to sue this ENTIRE COMPANY for discrimination.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Guys? You're arguing over a one in sixteen chance. Over a prize worth... forty bucks.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Um, fifteen thousand bucks, Oscar.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Yeah, shut it, Oscar. Pam?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: This is an amazing prize. I mean, I don't even want to give Pam a compliment, because she's so blegh, but she did a good job. I really want that coupon book.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Garbage magnet. [throws magnet] Garbage magnet, God! Magnets are interesting enough, you don't need to tart them up with some design. [to Michael] I can't believe this doesn't make you mad!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [staring at Gabe and Kevin] What the hell are they talking about?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hmm, Kevin and Gabe. Probably about the extremes of the human physique.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Do you think that Kevin is going over my head? I don't-[sees Kevin and Gabe fist-bump] Oh my GOD. Okay. All right. All right. You know what? That's inappropriate, Kevin. I am your boss, and if you have something to say, it goes through me, and then I take it to Gabe. Chain of command. Do you understand?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I am so sorry.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, you're sorry?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I just thought-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What did you just thought?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Well, Gabe asked me if there were any really cool Lady Gaga moves that he could do for the catwalk. And so then I tol-[tries not to cry]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I told him that there was this one cool move where she powers down like a robot.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Okay? But I- I am so sorry that I didn't tell you first.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, don't let it happen again.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [hysterical] You think that I would let this happen again?! NO WAY JOSE.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I-

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [bleep] you, Gabe!

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Okay...

quotes.speaker: Danny
quotes.text: Can you imagine? It's just crazy.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That is crazy. We would never care if Andy or Kevin went to your party.

quotes.speaker: Danny
quotes.text: Look, I'm just glad we can laugh about it. Because I was a little nervous about coming to work here, with, you know, our history.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, my gosh! People keep blowing it out of proportion! It's not even a history.

quotes.speaker: Danny
quotes.text: Exactly.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: It's not like you guys had some long relationship right? Big painful breakup I don't know about?

quotes.speaker: Danny
quotes.text: No! Two or three dates.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It was two.

quotes.speaker: Danny
quotes.text: Was it two? I thought it was three.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, we um, we had plans for a third, but then I don't know, you never called me back, so...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oooh! You can't handle the truth! [laughs]

quotes.speaker: Danny
quotes.text: [laughing] Well, that does not sound like me.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah? [stops laughing] It was though, that's what happened.

quotes.speaker: Danny
quotes.text: [stops laughing] Well, great, I just wanted to make sure that things weren't weird.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hmm-mm.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, this whole going over my head-gate? Is making people act weird. The chain of command is crumbling. Do you know what just happened? I just made Kevin cry. And Gabe looks like Lady Gaga. That's not Halloween. Halloween should be a day in which we honor monsters and not be mad at each other.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I'm not mad. Are you mad?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You went over my head. And then you lied to my face. So my head and my face have taken a beating.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Well, I'm sorry if it seems that way to you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, that might help. If you said "I'm sorry" in front of everybody.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Mike.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: In front of me.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: You made a bad call. And I fixed it. So I'm not apologizing.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So that's it.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: That's it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Is it?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Sookehhh. [removes teeth] Bill Compton, from True Blood.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: How many freakin' vampires am I supposed to care about these days?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I guess you could say I'm still in costume. I'm a rational consumer.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Stupid coupon booklet. Have you seen my costume? I'm a rational consumer.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Yeah, I uh, heard you say it to Phyllis. That's a good line.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay, everybody! After you walk the runway everyone has to vote for who gets the coupon book. And you can't vote for yourself.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Pam. Can you vote for other people?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, I gotta get in on this. [mocking Darryl] Hey, it's cool, man, I work in the warehouse! I'm cool! I'm hip and I'm jive! And I don't care about nobody! Do you know who I am? Happy Halloween, jerk!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Still don't know who I am? I'll give you a hint. I go over other people's heads.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael, this is a bad idea.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What's a bad idea?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Dressing up as somebody-I mean, when has that ever worked for you?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: NEVER! [tosses wig] Okay, you know what? Fine.  I'm not Darryl. And thank God I'm not Darryl.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Could you for once just let us enjoy a party instead of making it about all your issues?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: [walking down the runway] Raaah! [waves sword]

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I present to you the [finger quotes] rational consumer, as it were.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Angela as the nurse!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I don't like your tone! Look, they were sold out of all the other costumes, okay? I think we all live in the real world, here. Let's not pretend to be unaware of what sells in this office.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: What should we ask?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, can I play? Why don't you ask if Darryl is a bad friend who backstabs people in the back?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: We have one question to ask the spirit world and you want us to ask that?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: He says no.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Aaah! Darryl moved it. You moved it.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Dwight, you saw Darryl move it, right?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Let's just say I saw exactly what the two of you wanted me to see.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I know how to sit on a fence. Hell, I can even sleep on a fence. The trick is to do it face down with the post in your mouth.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: If you had one word you would use to describe Darryl what would that word be?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: [hands are being forced to the letters] A... S... S... H... E... T?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: An asset!

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Ah! [lets go, candy corn flies everywhere] That's enough.

quotes.speaker: Danny
quotes.text: I don't think it's gonna work out the way you think.

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: I don't think you get it.

quotes.speaker: Danny
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Danny
quotes.text: This is some party, huh?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: When you work hard, you play hard around here.  Even if you don't work hard. Oh, here's something. Uh, why didn't you ever call Pam back?

quotes.speaker: Danny
quotes.text: Are you serious?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah. I mean, I'm not saying that everyone has to fall in love, or anything, I'm just saying... but you know, to not even call her back is...

quotes.speaker: Danny
quotes.text: You know what it was? I think she gave me her number but then her fours look like eights, and...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Could be. But you also called her the second time so you had the number right.

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: Halpert, you lookin' for someone to bang your wife?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Nope.

quotes.speaker: Danny
quotes.text: Okay. You wanna know?  I didn't call her back because she spent the whole date talking about you. She was obviously in love with you.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Fifty seven. Fifty eight.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Wait, wait. She hasn't moved in awhile.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: [reaches over to pull Erin out of apple bobbing water] ERIN!

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Two! I got two. I ate two whole apples.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I'd remember talking about Jim. That wasn't it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Just tell her the real reason.

quotes.speaker: Danny
quotes.text: Do you honestly want to know why I didn't call her back on a date over four years ago?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey. She had a nice time. It seems rude.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I did. And it's just one of those things that's going to keep gnawing at me, like "gnaw, gnaw, why? Why didn't he? I have no idea why."

quotes.speaker: Danny
quotes.text: Okay. Honestly. I didn't call you back because I-thought you seemed a little... dorky.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey, man.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Thank you! Thank you. I got it. Now I know. You thought I was a little dorky. You know? [gibberish sounds] Okay. Well, excuuuuse me.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: In the future, you need to get Michael's approval on anything before coming to me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: You're gonna be missing out on some good ideas.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Okay, well, obviously if it's a really, really good idea, my door is open.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: If they're good ideas, I'm not gonna say no!

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: You said no to this one!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That was-okay, you make one mistake in fifteen years and you drag me over the coals, after everything I did for you?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: What have you done for me?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh...

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: What have you done for me?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well...

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Ed Truck hired me. Jo promoted me. Gabe listened to me. All you've ever done is say no to me. I have ambition. And you kept me at the same level for years.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Ohh. Dropping bombs, right? [explosion noise] This really make you think, Michael?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Stop it! Stop, stop. We're thinking. We're thinking about it.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You don't have to point to the fact that we're thinking about it. Stop it! Just let us think. Okay, next time you have a really great idea, we will put it in a hat, and then we will have Erin pick it out of the hat and let her decide.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I don't understand the point of a hat.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: You're right, we don't need a hat.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I am not budging on the hat issue.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Okay. We're going to table the hat question. The best ideas are going to come to me, I make the final decision, period.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay. We both reserve the right to go to Jo if we disagree with Gabe.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Okay, why don't we simplify this? Darryl brings it to Michael, Michael brings it to me, no one calls Jo.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Unless you and I decide we want to talk to Jo, then we'll give her a call.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Cool. Okay. Sorry I lied.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Sorry I was a jerk.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Friends fight. Friends fight.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What's up, man?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Sometimes it seems like it was better down in the warehouse, you know?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: When I was a freshman in college, I worked at the student newspaper, the Cornell Daily Sun? This was at Cornell. I had to write an op-ed column every day.  Bernard's Regards.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: This was your freshman year.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I started to ask myself, "Do I have big plans here?" I didn't want to become editor of that paper, so I got up and walked right out of Walter Bernard hall, and that's actually when I heard eight male voices, singing, unencumbered by instruments. I was hooked. So is becoming CEO of this company your a capella group?  Come on, we're going to Danny's bar. Public School.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: No. I got some work to do. I do got big plans with this company.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: To be honest, I still can't believe he didn't call her back. Who doesn't call a dork like that back?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, wow!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [holding Cece] Spinach in a can. Power eat spinach. [Popeye sound]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Aww, my hero!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay, everyone, I've tallied the votes, and the winner... of the costume celebration spectacular... and the Scranton Wilkes-Barre coupon book... Oscar Martinez.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: If I have to vote for someone, I don't want it to be someone who can beat me.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Shake things up. I'm a Nader guy.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Best Edward James Olmos costume I've ever seen. Like, freaky good.
